messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, I'm calling about my son.
What's your address, ma'am?
I'm on the side of the road. They took him in a car.
Ma'am, what address are you calling from?
I'm on the side of the road, I don't have an address.
Okay, you're on Whitaker Road. Ma'am? Whitaker Road and what?
I'm near Lincoln High School. Whitaker and Willis Road.
What kind of car are you in?
My car is disabled on the side of the road. It's gray.
Ma'am, they took your car too?
No, they took my son. He's two years old.
He's two years old, and you're at Whitaker and Willis Road, ma'am?
Yes, I'm on Whitaker Road, between Willis and Milet.
Okay, do you see a house near you?
No, I'm in the dark, in the country. My car is disabled.
What color is your car?
Gray, it's a gray Taurus.
Ma'am, take a deep breath. Who took your baby?
I don't know. Somebody stopped and said they'd help with my car.
Which way did he go?
Towards Paletti. It was a red pickup truck.
Did you get a license plate number?
No.
Did he go north on Whitaker from Willis Road?
Yes, northbound on Whitaker.
Ma'am, we have deputies on the way there right now. Tell me what else you can about the red truck.
It's old and has rust on it.
Is it a big truck or a small truck?
A small truck.
Maya, stay on the phone with me. The police are on the way. Tell me more about the truck that took your son.
It was a small, old, red truck with rust. That's all I saw. It's dark.
Stay in your car with the doors locked until the police get there, okay?
Please help me, there's a car behind me.
Okay, ma'am. We have help on the way. Tell me what else you can about the truck.
It was red, old, and had rust.
What did the person look like who took your son?
I don't know. It was dark.
Okay, ma'am. We have police on the way there. Can you tell me anything else about the person who took your son?
No, I'm in my car with my other kids. Please hurry.
Okay, they're on the way, ma'am. Stay in your car with the doors locked until the police get there.
